utterances: So do you remind us of the challenge you left us with last week?
Yes, I said rearrange the letters of charades to make two words that are synonyms.
The answer is race plus dash.
We had over 1,700 entries from people who solve the puzzle and our randomly selected winner is Bernadette Solano from Pacific City, Oregon.
Well, for the last four and a half years, I've been working with some colleagues to develop a mathematics program for high school students who are at risk of failing graduation requirement.
It finally was published a month ago so now I'm also training teachers how to use those materials and other materials are designed using the same principles.
How long have you been this one?
Well, a long time - longer and I've been married so it's at least 12 years.
With you at my side, I'm as ready - as ready I'll ever be, I think.
I feel the same way Bernadette.
So let's face Will and play.
All right, Bernadette, speaking of charades, every answer today is a six-letter word that can be broken into two consecutive three-letter words.
For example, if I said, what body part is a number plus a boy's name?
And you break tendon into ten and don.
Number one is what bird consists of a golf score plus nonsense?
And think of a three letter…
Number two, what kind of puzzle is a dance plus a carpenter's tool.
And think of a carpenter's tool in three letters.
So, I'm thinking of short, three letter carpenter tool.
Oh, no. Spanner is an English one.
A lumberjack might also use this tool.
And the jig part because I'm half Irish but…
What fabric is a place to sleep plus a heavy weight?
Something a hotel might give you if you have extra people in your room or what you might sleep on…
What planet consists of the abbreviation for a weekday plus a container?

Well, Abe himself has not commented on this directly as far as I know, but there were reports today that the Education Ministry is going to look into the entrance exams for all of Japan's medical schools.
So we'll see where that goes.
To see if scores have been doctored.
